seo.title: Payment Policy | Qption
seo.description: Qption’s payment policy covers account balance display, deposit and withdrawal procedures, client verification (KYC), tax obligations, and other key terms.
seo.keywords: payment policy, deposit, withdrawal, account balance, KYC, verification, tax, Qption
seo.ogDescription: Learn about Qption’s policies on deposits, withdrawals, balance visibility, KYC, and taxation.
seo.twitterDescription: Deposit/withdrawal procedures, balance responsibility, KYC, taxation, and more.

sections.title: 1. Account Balance Responsibility
items: The Company is responsible for displaying the Client’s account balance at any given time.
The Company’s responsibility begins once a deposit record is made and extends until a complete withdrawal request is processed by the Client.
The Client has the right to request funds available in their account at the time of inquiry.

sections.title: 2. Deposit and Withdrawal Procedures
items: Deposits and withdrawals are conducted through the official methods listed on the Company’s website.
Clients assume all risks associated with using payment methods, as these providers are not Company affiliates.
The Company is responsible for funds only once they reach the Company’s bank or payment account.

sections.title: 3. Client Registration
items: Registration requires providing accurate identity and contact details.
The verification process requires a government-issued ID.
The identification process must be completed within 10 business days.

sections.title: 4. Deposit Processes
items: Deposits are initiated from the Client’s personal account on the website.
Electronic payments may process in seconds or take several days depending on the provider.

sections.title: 5. Tax Obligations
items: The Company is not a tax agent for the Client; all tax declarations and payments remain the Client’s responsibility.

sections.title: 6. Miscellaneous Terms
items: By accepting the Contract, the Client confirms that they are of legal age.
The Client is responsible for ensuring compliance with all applicable local laws and regulations.
